description: Three storey side and rear extension to existing industrial premises
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: 1901/EX/001 (Location Plan), 1901/EX/001 (Existing Ground Floor - South Elevation), 1901/EX/002 (Existing First Floor - West Elevation),  1901/EX/003 (Existing Second Floor -North Elevation), 1901/EX/004(Existing Roof Plan - East Elevation), 1901/PL/001 rev C (Planning Ground Floor - South Elevation), 1901/PL/002(planning First Floor - West Elevation), 1901/PL/003 (Planning Second Floor - North Elevation), 1901/PL/004 (planning Roof Plan - East Elevation)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Notwithstanding condition 2, Details including samples of the materials and finishes to be used for all external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surroundings, in accordance with policies 7B and Policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

The parking arrangements for 6 vehicles (including one disabled parking bays) shown on drawing No. 1901/PL/001 rev C (Planning Ground Floor - South Elevation), shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available and shall not be used for any other purpose. No additional car parking shall be formed or made available.

REASON: To ensure that there is adequate parking provision within the site and to ensure that excessive parking is not provided, in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016); and section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

Sheltered and secure cycle parking as indicated on approved plan 1901/PL/001 rev C (Planning Ground Floor - South Elevation), shall be in place prior to first occupation of the development hereby permitted and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for cycle parking.

REASON: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided within the development in pursuance of the objectives of sustainability and encouraging the use of modes of transport other than private motor vehicles in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016); and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG.

| Refuse and recycling storage shall be provided in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be installed and implemented prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

REASON:  To ensure that suitable and accessible refuse storage facilities are provided and in the interests of the visual and general amenities of the area, in accordance with policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016)
| The approved extensions shall only be used as ancillary to the existing industrial use of the premises and no other use, and shall not be subdivided to create separate units.

In order to restrict the use of the premises in the interest of the strategic function of this designated Locally Significant Industrial Land for industrial and warehousing purposes in accordance with policy 4A of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 2.17 and 4.4 of The London Plan (2016) and guidance within the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
